content: POP or IMAP accounts? Any filters? Did you verify Thunderbird's spam folder? By default Thunderbird uses View > Sort By > Threaded ..., so the missing messages might be hidden in a discussion (thread). Go to Settings > Appearance and activate the radio-button ◉ Unthreaded
creator: Mapenzi

content:
You're saying that you can't even find the thunderbird client? I will assume you use Windows and my suggestions follow that assumption.

  1. enter %appdata% in search box in task bar and press enter
  2. that should open file explorer at appdata\roaming
  3. locate the thunderbird folder and COPY it to somewhere else (this shouldn't be needed, but just being safe)
  4. download thunderbird from thunderbird.net, preferably the same release you were using (either the ESR or Monthly release) and install
  5. start thunderbird and it should open to the proper profile

This assumes that the profile itself was not corrupted. If the above doesn't work, please provide some specifics. thank you.
creator: davidsk

creator: terry691

content:
Being prompted to enter email address again indicates thunderbird had problems with the old profile. To clear and restart this process, I suggest this:

  1. as before, locate and copy the appdata\thunderbird folder to a safe place. do this with thunderbird not running
  2. uninstall thunderbird
  3. download and install the ESR version from https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/ that is version 140.
  4. start thunderbird
  5. if prompted for an email address, skip it, and click help>troubleshootinginformation
  6. then, scroll to 'profiles' and and click 'about:profiles'
  7. the next screen will list all profiles. Your old one should be there. see if you can launch it and let me know status.
creator: davidsk

content:
I wonder if there was an update and thunderbird may have created a new profile. Just a guess, but you can check:

  1. click help>troubleshootinginformation
  2. scroll down to 'profiles' and click 'about:profiles
  3. the next screen is a list of profiles. Click to open one that is not active
  4. now, click the Mail folder and then the Local Folders folder to see if any message folders are there. If so, you found the missing items. Let me know and we can proceed from there.
creator: davidsk

content: If you have added new local folders, yet a screenshot of Mail\Local Folders is now showing them, then we are not seeing the right folders. Thunderbird cannot have folders that are hidden from Windows. You are stating that if you go to appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles that there is only one profile. And the profile does not show the Local Folders that are displayed in Thunderbird. It just doesn't add up to me. Maybe someone else will see the discrepancy.
creator: davidsk

content:
Dear David,

Thank you very much for your help. I have found the solution to my problem. My Local Folders were not stored in the Profile, but in a different folder, as shown in the screenshot "Print Screen_Solution". Right-clicking on Local Folders/Settings displays the path. After a recent Windows update, for some unknown reason, my original folders were rearranged, and I lost the path to my old emails. The Windows "search" option helped me find my old "Local Folders", and I was able to copy them back to the correct location.

It seems simple now, but it took me a few days to figure out what had happened. I hope this post might save someone else some time.

Kind regards, Jasmina
creator: jobhodas
